name: Sherif Merdani
description: '''Sherif Merdani''' (14 May 1940 – 29 August 2021) was an Albanian singer and later diplomat, known for his contribution to Albanian [[light music]] during the late 1960s and early 1970s. His artistic career was abruptly halted by the communist regime, following the aftermath of the [[Festivali i Këngës 11|11th edition]] of [[Festivali i Këngës]], which led to his arrest and imprisonment. After the fall of communism and his release from the notorious Qafë-Bari Prison, where he spent part of his 16 years, Merdani returned to public life and served in Albania's diplomatic service.
